author: HDaughter
title: An exceptional student nurse
body:
My mum suffers from Alzheimer's. She was admitted to hospital after antibiotics at home failed to cure her kidney infection and her situation had worsened by not eating and drinking. After issues with her gp, she eventually started getting treatment from the hospital at home team. They came out and assessed her and were excellent. They arranged her to be admitted to forth valley hospital as she was so dehydrated they were concerned she had sepsis.  
She was moved to AAU3 where an exceptional student nurse called Francie gave her fantastic care and attention. At home I had been trying to get my mum to drink and eat and had only managed small amounts of trifle. When I visited I had some trifle and spoon fed my mum a small amount and had managed to get her to take some water. Francie had came in as I was playing music to my mum.  
The next day when I phoned it was Francie who answered. She had been caring for my mum and had got her to eat a full yoghurt and take a cup of tea which was amazing! She had also put music on for her similar to what I had played the night before she also provided a full update of my mum's status and condition.  
By the time I went to visit in the evening Francie had managed to get my mum to eat a full bowl of soup and some more tea.  
I have been informed Francie is due to qualify in a few weeks. I understand health care staff have a duty to make sure patients eat and drink but Francie had really paid attention to my mum and the music she put on was not necessary but it's these little things that make all the difference especially for a dementia patient.  
I am so pleased Francie was there with my mum and the relief it gives a family member especially ones who's a carer is overwhelming.  
My big thanks to Francie and the team in Forth Valley Acute Assessment Unit (AAU and AAU3) and Carla from the Frailty Team for taking great care of my mum and going that extra mile to make her stay more comfortable

author: thomasmc007
title: anti biotics causing harm
body:
I recently got prescribed anti biotics for an ear infection which cleared my infection up ,however 3 days later, infection came back. I was then prescribed a stronger dose for a further week which cleared the infection instead of making me better the anti biotics attacked my liver which in turn has now caused me to have jaundice from head to toe with a bilirubin count of 597 which for a normal person should be around 20 .  
This is causing a lot of problems and very concerning to my health. This is still ongoing an very concerning to both my doctor in hospital as this has been confirmed as anti biotic that has caused this.  
To think I had a liver problem with fatty tissue 3yrs back scarring my liver you would think they wouldn't be prescribed this course.  
But given I haven't been able to even speak to a doctor, what chance have I got if my notes on my health are not read properly before prescribing.

readBy.name: Office of Shirley-Anne Somerville, MSP for Dunfermline

author: Mandriver
title: Long telephone queues
body: Never have I come across a Dr's surgery like this, This morning I was held on the phone for 50 minutes with a queue of 19, I held on till number 2 in the queue and got cut off, not impressed one little bit!!

author: puppised76
title: Phone consultation by GP
body:
In short, it is about GP services. I have had blood pressure problems for more than 15 years. Since the beginning of the pandemic, I have not been able to be consulted by a GP at the treatment of blood pressure or physically consulted in this matter. I have asked many times to be sent to a cardiologist and to have a proper consultation done by a cardiologist doctor, when it about hypertension.  
I received countless refusals to be consulted by at least one doctor from the GP. Unfortunately, my problems with hypertension continue. And the GPs are constantly changing the treatment over the phone. It's very frustrating for me to get here. You can only be consulted by a doctor by phone. Which is an aberration. It is against everything I have learned and I know it is done by a doctor.  
In the last month, I called countless times and prayed, I begged to be consulted by a doctor, not by phone. In the end, they made an appointment with a doctor from the GP. I also received the phone message reminding me not to forget about the appointment with that doctor.  
I went there at the appointed time. I was invited to the office by the doctor. But the doctor came out and I stayed with the nurse. I thought that nurse would take my blood pressure and then the doctor would come back to talk to you.  
But, to my surprise, the nurse did not take my blood pressure, instead she started asking me:  
1. How do I feel?  
2. What if I have an allergy to something?  
At that moment, I became very careful and asked what these questions were for?  
The very serene and confident nurse told me that I will receive the flu vaccine and the one for Covid !(I wanna mention here that I had my Covid Vaccine in July 2021)  
My dear readers, the next second I got up from my chair and asked to call the doctor to give me an explanation.  
The doctor came, but he was very indignant at the refusal of the vaccines.  
I answered like this:  
I came here to the clinic today because I have a consultation with my doctor for my hypertension and to talk about treatment.  
Very intrigued because I refused any vaccine, the doctor told me that I was not called for consultation, but I was scheduled for vaccination. He finally gave me a prescription by which he doubled one of the pills for hypertension, with a very short explanation, after which I was invited out of the office.  
My dear readers, we live in times we have never lived in our lives.  
The conclusion of my story:  
The best doctor is only yourself.  
Do not have any expectations from anyone but you.  
London 2021, taxpayer, to no longer be able to be consulted by a doctor physical and mental, only to hear him on the phone.  
Science fiction movie script ???  
Unfortunately no, it's a reality.

author: lizsh36
title: My son wants to go home
body:
My son has autism and was diagnosed by a specialist with aspergers in 2020.  
He was arrested in February 2021, not released on bail, but sent to a mental health unit in Darlington, then Hartington Unit in Derbyshire, and the police did not notify me as I was looking for my son.  
My son is now in the Radbourne Unit in Derby. The Doctor gave my son antipsychotic drugs and I believe steriods as my son was around 12 stones, now over 20 stones, struggling to breath, bullied in the unit as I try and speak to him every day.  
The Mental Health Act Officer is nowhere to be seen as no reports from the GP, and Staff were not monitered, I try and speak to staff and all I speak to is untrained staff who sound like they have just left school.  
My son expressed he wants to go home, and a meeting in October was cancelled as my son's social worker did not attend, not even leaving any information towards the review, and it was done on zoom and my son stuck in a room. The advocate, doctor and other staff on the panel decided to bring the review forward to early December 2021.  
My son is no threat to himself or anyone in the Unit. The Mental Health Act Officer has not sent me a report from the Gp, no treatment written, as when there was a meeting for my son, The Gp and Social worker for my son did not produce it to the Judge. The Tribunal again was all one sided and the advocate did say the staff lied about visiting times, and other matters.  
If it was their family member in there, they would not be happy and would want them home.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Booksuccess
title: The journey to recovery
body:
At the beginning of October 2021 my mother blacked out and fell head first, smashing her face onto the kitchen floor at home.  
My sister and I were with her in 10 seconds.  
We thought my God has she just dropped dead! Surely not! Please God that cannot have happened to our beloved good natured mother who has never a cross word for anyone.  
To be honest we were screaming for her to wake up as we tried to bring her round not knowing if she was dead or had just knocked herself out.  
So after about 15 seconds she came round completely dazed. But all we could think was that she was still alive. Thank God above.  
We phoned the ambulance and our neighbour and retired family doctor came in to assess the situation to reassure us and mum.  
The ambulance arrived and I went with her to A&E in Antrim hospital. Once she was assessed there, her brutal injuries were revealed to me by the IC doctor Ceril.  
His absolute concern for her was overwhelming to me and I will never forget his kindness.  
Mum had a deep cut in her forehead needing 7 stitches, a bleed on the brain, broken nose, shattered eye socket and disastrously a broken neck.  
Ceril handed her over to Gary in IC to continue urgent care along with his staff and between them and colleagues in the Royal Victoria we took a second ambulance to Belfast in the early hours of the morning as her face and head turned black and blue with bruising.  
Within less than 24 hours mum was admitted to Major Trauma. Her progress in the first week was surprising but maybe and who knows shock took a hold of her and she became very ill. By the following Tuesday before I had even written her surname in the visitors book a doctor was behind me to give me the update on her, which had no future.  
But you see I nor my family could give up on her. Once I had gathered myself and spoke to my siblings , yes we agreed should her heart stop she should not be resuscitated, but I pleaded with the doctors that they did not know her as we did and her care should continue as if she would recover. I understand doctors are realists but we have an amazing prayer circle , the pain for us was how could mum leave this world with so many injuries , why could she not have just had peace which she deserves and slept away.  
So the fight began from everywhere and everyone including her. Her phone call to me the first week continued to ring in my ears.  
From the intense care and kindnesses of Major Trauma to the pressure madness of Ward4D, constant phone calls for updates from hierarchy in the system to nurses on the ground we never stopped.  
This was a frantic time for us because we could see how frantic the workload is for the staff in that ward. We worried that a ninety year old would get lost.  
Four weeks later mum was admitted to Whiteabbey Acute Fracture rehabilitation.  
Five weeks later after a time of three very difficult conversations with doctors in each of these wards of care to their astonishment mum has pulled through. The medicine and treatments have worked , the ‘Care’ on its own , ‘ What can I say?’ It was and is the care she has received from nursing. The doctors , nurses , assistants. Dieticians, Ambulance drivers , X-ray, that brought her to this stage of recovery.  
The staff I spoke to **doctors** Ceril , Gary , Antrim .  
**Royal Victoria Hospital **  
Elise, Agor, Peter, Megan Doctors,  
Colm consultant Major trauma,  
Nurses Megan , Rebecca  
Kay  
**Dietitian** Julie  
Kathryn ; Mr Verzin’s secretary  
Janet, registrar  
**Doctors **  
Finnula  
Paul  
Nurse Claire  
**Whiteabbey **  
Doctor Justin  
All the amazing nurses, Carers , nutritionists, dieticians and physiotherapists who have shown such kindness and positivity, professionalism and skill.  
Thankyou from our family and mum and our devoted prayer circle who prayed for you all and will continue to do so.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Martin T
title: Admission with COVID-19
body:
Covid hit me hard, unexpectedly as I am fit strong, training 5 days a week.  
I was admitted to A&E in Coleraine and quickly diagnosed, X-Ray’d and moved onto a Covid ward for ongoing treatment.  
The staff I encountered were the absolute best people humans on the planet. I am so grateful for each of their kindness and help over the 9 days.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Unable to get an appointment
body:
It has become almost impossible to get an appointment here. I have had to make a complaint previously about the old appointment system and miraculously when I eventually spoke to the practice manager I go an appointment that afternoon!
However things have got even worse now and while I understand the pressures that GPS are under it is ridiculous that you have to give far too much detail to a medically unqualified receptionist who decides if a Doctor will call you and then when you do speak to one they can’t answer your question as they are just an employee and they say they will find out but never get back to you. 
I am actively looking to change Practises now due to the complete lack of reliable help that is available here.

title: Untrustworthy!!
body: After the second attempt on his life a home visit was arranged for my son,it took alot of persuasion to get him to agree to this because "The Bridge" had let him down before! He barely slept worrying about the visit and just sat waiting untill 11.30 came and went,waited and waited,nothing! 5.30pm I rang them,they were busy apparently... they had my number and his,to inform us they were not going to turn up,now understandably he won't let himself be let down again.I am disgusted!!!!

title: Great practice
body: Event very well organised. Friendly and helpful staff. A very positive experience.

title: Booster day
body: Long queue when I arrived but wow before I knew it i was next.Fantastic organisation and friendly staff to help us all.

title: Covid booster
body: Great service wonderful health care professionals and brilliant volunteers. My experience was a positive one. I did have to queue but appreciate the service the medical centre provides together with its staff.

title: Great Practice
body: Good communication. Whole process efficient from start to finish. Friendly informative staff. Felt very Covid safe.

title: Covid vaccination
body: Well organised clinic with helpful, friendly staff, even at the end of a 8 hour stint! Thank you to all

title: Absolutely awful
body: I struggle with self harm and suicidal thoughts. I can say CAMHS did absolutely nothing to help whatsoever. The only thing they did was completely invalidate me, and make out I wasn’t bad enough. I was in hospital for a suicide attempt and CAMHS had to call me over the phone in order to agree for me to be able to go home. I was accused of being on drugs by the worker, and told to just ‘hurry up and just agree i won’t try it again.’ so i could go home and the worker could end the call. I felt like a complete burden and was not helped at all, they discharged me after every suicide attempt, and even got annoyed when I kept getting re-admitted. Also refuse to diagnose anything, and refer to me as having ‘low mood’ and ‘emotional disregularity’ or something. Asked for a diagnosis and they say ‘what would it achieve?’ all i ever wanted was to know what was wrong with me. You are honestly better not going at all as I can assure you all they will do it make you feel worse.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Unfair treatment
body:
Past 8 month Durham  crisis team and the A and e departments ilasion team 

For months I'd been telling them I was suicidale didn't belive me just keep thinking safe send home then I tried to end my life twice then they got involved when weres the help to prevent that what would of happend if it had worked it would of been to late!!

Past 2 nights been in A e cos I feel like that again and get pillar to post rejection even told of for coming in to get help when have crisis team that never helped me what else am I supposed to do told me you can't keep doing this and for a crisis team while in a abulance try convince paramedic turn around take him home safest place for him when suicidal and plan in place is appauling how would they like if there relative was treat in this way people wouldn't have to go in to A e if crisis team helped the way suppost to

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

author: foxtrotdx43
title: Poor care and discharge experience
body:
My dad was admitted with a fall. His leg was checked over and no fracture or break ,they kept him in over the weekend for some physio and to see ot, I got to see dad on a Sunday afternoon, he didn't look well and had a crackle in his chest despite numerous phone calls from myself to say he can't lie flat due to his Parkinson's and can't breathe properly.  
I called that night to be asked to speak to a doctor who asked me to come up straight away, They suspected a stroke and was going to treat for seizures to which I explained it was tremors due to Parkinson's, they commenced on a drip for fluids, antibiotic and glucose levels they stated over his bed they would treat him medically and it was basically his Parkinson's. They said he was confused and had incapacity which is untrue, he was refused drinks overnight which I complained about every visit, was being put in his notes and on the board above his bed. My dad tested positive on the day he was sent home, nothing on his patient notes to state covid. My dad was sent home for palliative care having been a man who walked with a zimmer, made his meals to someone double incontinent , unable to walk or talk and problems urinating because they also caused trauma trying to catheterize him when he had an enlarged prostate.  
I received him home at 7.30pm on a Friday night with no continence aids. If it wasn't for the help of the care provider we would have had nothing. I witnessed a few members of staff walking about with masks below their nose on several occasions and also told my dad was now bed blocking as nothing could be done. 6 people in a room only one meal appeared to be eaten, these men some with dementia, didn't appear to be made aware that their meal was there. If they didn't answer their preference, then it seemed that they received what the staff decided to give them. The 4 hand sanitizers on the walls around the room had no sanitizer in them.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: cafewk79
title: Pushing me when I wasn't ready
body:
The care I've experienced has not been patient-centered. I have cfs/ME, they didn't seem to want to accept it and were not patient, just banging on about discharging me when I was really ill.  
I felt coerced into family therapy. That was a joke. No screening for domestic abuse was conducted prior to family therapy.  
CFS/ME service liased with East glade and that was all Graded Exercise Therapy, which I consider to be a form of medical gaslighting and it made me bedbound!  
Family therapist said there isn't any reason why I couldn't walk to bathroom (when my Functional Neurological Disorder symptoms were bad - seizures and paralysis) and encouraged my parents not to help me e.g. not to get water for me when paralysed.  
They wouldn't wait a few months until I was ready for an intervention, and were pushing to do it when I wasn't ready.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Inadequate
body: Avoided this as I don't like to do negative reviews & feel staff are no doubt over worked, under resourced etc. But when you are feeling vulnerable, its the opposite of what you need for recovery. Main focus is on questionnaires/depression & anxiety scores.  Local mental health organisations (when I asked them for any support available) asked which counselling services I'd used, said that they have a poor reputation. I'm trying to save up to return to private counselling, which is the difference between night and day.

author: Marie36
title: Follow-up phone appointment
body: I got a follow up phone appointment for my daughter, it was good as it makes you feel you haven’t been forgot about. As well makes a decision weather you need an appointment or not  to see a consultant, so your not taking up appointments other people might need quicker.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic Support
body: I can't thank the surgery enough for caring and their support. I have had a difficult time and changes in life. They have been terrific. We are all not blessed with a loving family in life. I feel with the support and care I receive from the staff They are there for me and heal the wound when others don't. They make the experience a fun one and honest with their advice. They have been patient and accomodating when certain forces are not being. Thank you so much for putting up with me all this time.

author: swingrj88
title: Fantastic service
body: A few weeks ago I found a small lump and had also noticed some colour changes to my skin. I felt nervous and very worried so called the Health Centre on Frederick Street and within an hour someone called Mark called me back. He was very reassuring and spent time listening to my concerns before offering an appointment. I’ve now been seen him twice and on both occasions he has been knowledgeable, friendly and reassuring whilst I received treatment. His amazing care is a credit to the NHS and I just want to say “thank you”.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Very straight forward
body:
The practice was well organised with very little waiting time, the nurse was welcoming, reassuring and administrated the booster quickly.
 Any

Many thanks to all involved.

title: Very straight forward
body:
The practice was well organised with very little waiting time, the nurse was welcoming, reassuring and administrated the booster quickly.
 Any

Many thanks to all involved.

title: 5* Service
body:
Visited Gynaecology and received 5* quality service. Care was outstanding, I was made so comfortable and my anxiousness put at ease, with wonderful bedside manor and efficiency. 
Thank you very much to the whole department.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very straight forward
body:
The practice was well organised with very little waiting time, the nurse was welcoming, reassuring and administrated the booster quickly.
 Any

Many thanks to all involved.

title: breath of fresh air
body: i have joined this practice late in my life ,and for the last two joys , it is a joy to deal with such professional and caring people in all positions at the practice. different as chalk and cheese from my previous practice

title: Good practice
body: Staff were very helpful and kind. Understood my needs and helped me solve my problem. I wanted to register and they guided me through it and I don't regret it. Someone called Tia was such a great help I would recommend E7 to all my family.

title: Changed my life
body: I have struggled all my life and learnt CBT and started medication 2 years ago but I knew I need to get help. I started councelling and just a short period of 9 sessions my life completly changed I can be present now instead of constantly worry about the future! I'm able to drive now and even got a job. My marriage is stronger. I feel OK and happy first time in 2 decades. I recommend this councelling to everyone who struggles to give a try. You can't loose anything just gain.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: good service
body: a beautiful, clean clinic with a supportive staff. I moved from London to this area about  3 years ago. I liked the way doctors give you time, listen to your problem in detail.

title: Really pleasant and helpful receptionist
body:
The receptionist today was lovely. Really pleasant to talk to and very helpful.
One or two other receptionists could take a leaf out of her book.

title: Fantastic service
body: From reception staff to care advisors, nurses and doctors - the treatment at Peverell Park Surgery has been brilliant, staff are so empathetic I couldn’t believe it. Seen quickly face to face as well as phoned back quickly when required. Really means a lot so keep doing what your doing. Thank you!

title: Ward 28 and plastic trauma clinic
body:
I visited the hospital on the 14/11/21 to have a operation on my little finger. 

The staff on ward 28 are amazing, very kind amazing attitude and very friendly. 

I would like to thank them for my care before my surgery and after my surgery.

The room I was in with the other 3 lads was clean and tidy and comfortable. 
Hope the othe lads recover well also.

I would like to thank the surgeon and his staff for the amazing work they do under pressure and low staffing.

I felt really comfortable and was told step by step all the way of what was happening so very pleased and would give the full staff on the ward a 10 out of 10 so thank you 

Ds

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Flu vaccination at Corfe Hills School
body: Well organised from start to finish. Cheerful, upbeat and professional staff made it a surprisingly pleasant experience

title: Totally outstanding
body: The level of efficiency and compassion from everyone at the surgery is just exceptional.My son and I have had to move around a fair bit and have been lots of different surgeries, this one is without a doubt the best we’ve ever been at. We feel supported and respected and are always able to access care very quickly. Within the local community people often say good things about this surgery. They are a huge asset and deserve recognition for exceptional service especially in the light of the pandemic and austerity.

title: Very good care and service
body: I always find the staff and doctors very good at their jobs whether it be reception to doctors and very helpful and courteous surgery

title: Urgent care - extremely slow
body: Ring 111 get told go queens child has chest pains. Waiting time 3 hours we are now at 4hrs asked for pain meds  had nothing  very slow watching kids throw up over floor and left to be walked in by other patients no sign of a cleaner on hand for such incidents talk about germs !!! Expect to be here for some time update notice boards at least !!!!

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent staff and team
body:
I have been with this practice for nearly 12 years and have always found the practitioners receptive and informative and very easy to communicate with. The front of house staff are also experienced and helpful, as is the manager. 
I'm shortly moving house and the walk to this practice will then be twice as long as before, but it will be worth it because this is the best team that have ever looked after me.
Thank you.

title: Friendly practice
body: I was called for my Covid booster jab and although the queue was long, we moved quickly, and everyone friendly and helpful. The practice nurse was lovely!

title: Thank You
body:
Dear Tambootie Ward and Ultrasound Department,
I attended and was monitored in Tambootie Ward last Wednesday 10th in the evening, Thursday 11th at about 930pm, and had an ultrasound on Friday 12th in the morning. I just wanted to say thank you to the people who looked after me, it was a very supportive experience.

title: Exemplary service
body:
Today I made an emergency appointment to see a doctor, the doctor I saw today who I’ve seen before was fantastic and the service was agin to a very high standard.
Also the receptionist that dealt with me on arrival I would like to add was outstanding which is why I felt I would like to leave a review.
Taking into account we are still dealing with this awful pandemic, the service was the best I’ve received at the surgery.
Thank you very much.

author: TashaGC
title: No Personalised care needs met
body:
My daughter had a baby 3.5 months ago and has been in hospital (Leicester Royal Infirmary)with the baby ever since.  
She has recently moved to ward 12 where the management team have not adopted a personalised care approach. In fact it feel uncaring  
My daughter has been told that she is unable to be in the hospital at the same time as her partner. The issue here is twofold. Firstly, the baby is breastfeed and currently cluster feeds so she is unable to leave him for prolonged periods of time. Secondly, her partner lives in another city and due to working hours usually stayed at the hospital Friday evening on Sunday evening to provide support for my daughter.  
Their family network at this difficult time is being destroyed and my daughter’s mental well-being is severely compromised. Being on her own 24 hrs a day with a newborn is difficult. This is compounded by the fact that she has to sit in a chair all day and is unable to get a sleep during the day. The baby is also awake every 1.5 hrs at night.  
I feel like my daughter will end up mentally unstable due to stress before something is done  
The communication between the team is poor with one manager agreeing an approach today only to have the decision changed that afternoon or the next day  
She needs help now!!!!

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Fantatic service
body: I rarely visit the Doctors, and had heard how difficult things are currently for all surgeries. I have been stunned at just how good the service from my initial phone call to the receptionist, then a brilliant call back from the Doctor, to next day appointment with a nurse then the doctor. It was just fantastic. The Doctor (whom I am not supposed to name), diagnosed the problem, got a prescription organised within 2 hours and phoned me 2 days later with blood test results and update.  I cannot fault in any way the service I have received. Today I phoned back surgery to ask for the Doctor to call me ,back with a slight problem with the medication, I was called back within the hour ......and problem solved.  Thank you , it was outstanding from initial contact to resolution.

title: Very quick
body: My daughter and I have both been suffering with a very bad cough. We both did an e consult form and had phone appointments today.  I had an appointment with the Pharmacist who was very understanding and helpful and my daughter spoke to a nurse  Fantastic service .

title: Excellent people
body: No problems and very helpful. The COVID restrictions were in place and very well organised. Felt very safe and well looked after. There was a very clean ambiance.

title: Impressive Practice
body: As with all NHS services, the practice has been under enormous pressure over the past two years. However, in my experience they have coped very well. The staff have done a great job. Their vaccination programme has been well organised and very efficient via texts and letters, for both Flu and Covid. Earlier in the year I had minor surgery at the practice, which I was also very pleased with. Keep up the good work, to all staff, your work is much appreciated!

title: Fantastic service
body:
I must say that I can't praise the staff of that surgery enough. Serious. The nurse is absolutely a gem. Friendly, very easy to talk to, she really went the extra mile to assist me, she cares and it shows. On top of that blood work and flu jab with her are a completely pain free experience. . I really felt like she was listening to me , asking me relevant questions and was absolutely top class. As for the GP, the one that follows me is really nice as well. Very calming, relieves my stress and is really really easy to take to.. 

Would I recommend the surgery, big time yes.

Only problem. It is very hard to get an appointment. The phone line is non stop busy and when you finally talk to someone, there are no appointment left🙁. Other than that, it is really a 5 stars surgery

title: bad
body: I have not been able to make an appointment for months and months,last time i went to reception and was told i had to phone,i phoned early and was told i couldn't have an appointment even though i explained that i was feeling really rough,i asked if a GP could phone me and was told no they could not.I am 69 years old and at that time i was having trouble standing for long time so when i was told there is a walk in clinic up and running again at a certain time,thats when i asked for a phone call.I now have a continuous cough and chest problem that has been troubling me for nearly a year,i phoned this morning and still cannot get an appointment.Mrs L.Calverley

title: Great practice
body: Never have any issue here must  of saved me more then once my doctor always taken care and tension to my illness

author: CC45
title: Birth and Postpartum
body: I would like to thank all the midwifes at CAH for their excellent care during my labour and the compassion they showed towards myself and my partner during and after birth. I would also like to thank the community midwife team special mention to Diane and student midwife Hannah who cared for us all after birth. They both made the journey very enjoyable and no question was to much. Keep up the fabulous work. Xx

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: affected parent
title: Did not receive helpful service
body:
I was shocked at the service from CAMHS Leicester. When my child did not receive helpful service from the staff member assigned, and after asking for help of service to be replaced with another health professional, I started receiving demanding letters signed by the same staff member.  
It felt like the person that was assigned for my child was responding on behalf of their boss, saying that they disagree with the statement of my child not receiving help without any evidence considered. So, even if you complain, the same staff member you complained about writes you the response and can cut off from the services as a following result.

title: Awful service
body:
Booked here for my COVID jab. First of all the name given on the email for the venue does not match the name in person. This is actually a pharmacy with a completely different name.

I arrived for my covid jab and the lady at the counter handed me a piece of paper to write down my name, DOB and booking reference and time of appointment. This paper contained alll the details of other patients who had been in on the same day. Very poor data protection- or should I say lack of!

Whilst I was waiting, another customer came in to buy medication. He wanted to pay with a £20 note. The lady at the counter said she had no change and asked the gentleman to ‘go down the road and make your own change then come back’. If this pharmacy cannot take payments in cash then a card machine should be provided and it should be clearly signposted that change is not available.

When I arrived for my covid jab, there were 2 other patients waiting ahead of me. When I asked the lady at the counter at my appointment time how long the wait will be- she informed me that the vaccines are only just being made up and this will take another 10mins! Very badly organised for a vaccination centre with pre booked appointments!!

Overall I will NOT be attending here again for ANYTHING and will not recommend this pharmacy to anyone!

author: frostwf36
title: Attending pulmonary rehab
body: I would like to say what an enlightening experience it was with the wonderful team lead by Vanessa at the Rolls Royce sports club in Hucknall. Whilst working hard with myself and the other patients they made it fun and encouraged us to Achieve or goals I personally learnt a lot of ways to help with my condition and found the information given to be very helpful. They are a Five star Team and I’d like to say a Big Thank You to all of them.

title: Speedy Response
body:
I needed to start my rescue pack and discovered that it was out of date! It was Sunday so I sent an email to the surgery with my request. At 9:45 on the Monday I got a phone call from the surgery suggesting that although I get my repeat prescriptions filled by a third party it would be quicker if they sent it to a chemist of my choice that way I could get it same day! Within the hour I received a text saying it was ready for collection.
I know GP’s and surgeries have been criticised a lot recently, so thought it would only be fair to feedback this thoughtful service I have received today
Thank you

title: Quick appointment for my son
body: I called in the morning and was able to have a doctor look at my sons ear an hour later. Doctor was very friendly and reassuring. I was really impressed with the attention given, through the phone, at the reception and the consultation.

title: The very best care in the very worst time.
body:
Me and my late husband have used this surgery for over 10 years, with mixed experiences during the significant change in personnel and management. However, I can say on behalf of both myself and my late husband, this time our experience was the very best in the very worst of times.
Our GP could not have shown more compassion, care, expertise and support to us both (a married couple, in their 40s, shock diagnosis of a very rare and fatal cancer). Even though we had to move trusts to receive secondary care, our GP was always there for us, even if just to offer words of support and kindly listen.

Thank you to both our GP and the Practice Nurse who also looked after me specifically with regard to mental health support.

author: T.rx
title: From the first visit my daughter picked up new words
body: My daughter who was 2 and a half 2 months ago was struggling with her speech. speaking around 5 to 8 words barely. We are part of the Small steps Big changes organisation. When i expressed my consern to the SSBC, my daughters family mentor sent out a home talk leaflet. Immediately I did a referral online and was contacted the very same day by email by a very pleasant gentleman who explained someone from hometalk will be in contact via phone in the coming week. 2 days later a lovely lady contacted me and explained in great detail what home talk was about, how it will benefit myself and my daughter and who I would be assigned to. The following week I was contacted by my speech therapist called Hazel. From our first conversation I was absolutely impressed. Hazel was so professional as well as friendly and I felt as if I could express my concerns to Hazel without any hesitation. From the very first visit I knew instantly that Hazel would help my daughter start to talk. From the first visit my daughter picked up new words from Hazel. Hazel talked me through the stages of children communicating and understanding, and this helped me understand why some children have a delay in speech. Our 6 visits consisted of multiple different activities including making play dough, books, bag activities, different accessories to label. I was completely impressed. Hazel also gave me several tips and tricks to help my daughter. Building up to the last few visits I, and several other family members had noticed a huge difference in my daughters speech. From only saying 5-8 words she was now saying about 30/40 words and had started saying about 20/25 words independently. I wholeheartedly cannot thank Hazel enough. She is absolutely phenomenal. I truly believe home talk as a whole organisation has helped myself as well as many other parents with delayed speech of their children. This service would benefit a lot more parents and children if it were available in all areas as it has helped me. I cannot express enough that if it wasn't for home talk my daughter would still be struggling with her speech.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

title: Caring, attentive, professional
body:
During my recent illness I felt very cared for by GPs and nurses alike. I received regular phone calls, some planned and some not but prompted by our of hours A&E visits. Nothing was too much trouble and I was given the best medical care. Although I never needed a face to face appointment I knew this was available and that staff would not hesitate to make such an appointment if they felt I needed it.
Thank you so much

author: Halewood96
title: Exceptional care
body: My daughter visited the Walk in with a suspected asthma attack and very low oxygen saturation. Throughout waiting, triage, and treatment, all members of staff were incredibly attentive and knowledgeable and really helped my child feel calm and relaxed throughout a very stressful situation. My child needed to visit the hospital, but could only do this through the ambulance service as she required a constant supply of oxygen. An ambulance could not attend the walk in centre until over 12 hours after we arrived for a diagnosis, meaning staff had to stay with us once the centre had closed until the early hours of the morning to keep my daughter on oxygen. Throughout this, each member of staff was incredibly kind and reassuring, providing her with an outstanding level of care and support, not once complaining even though they were all still in work hours and hours after their shifts should have finished. I really feel that each member of staff went above and beyond their job descriptions to ensure both my child and myself felt calm and comfortable the entire time waiting for the ambulance. I am so grateful and thankful for the care my child received from all of the staff at Halewood walk in centre.

readBy.name: North West Boroughs Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: jdi21
title: Ward 5E Royal Victoria Hospital - lack of any communication
body:
My 96 year old Mother fell at home in November 2021. Ambulance came and were terrific with her - took her to Royal Victoria Hospital A & E. The Doctor phoned to let me know there were no breaks in the xray but she still couldn't put weight on her right leg. An OT and Physio were to check on her.  
The OT rang me and said that Mum would be staying in overnight. The next day she was still unable to bear weight on the leg so she was admitted to ward 5E to have a CT Scan for soft tissue examination. This was carried out on the following day. I was able to visit that evening (only 2 visits per week permitted) but no results available. Mum was very confused and upset(she has never been in hospital before) . She has 2 hearing aids - one was in the wrong ear and the other was on her bedside cabinet. She was sitting in a chair in her nightie with her legs bare. I was shocked at the deterioration in her mental and physical being. Mum lived alone with help from myself and carers twice daily but she is definitely in a worse condition now. I saw an improvement towards the end of my visit once I reassured her and chatted a while.  
For 2 days now I have tried to ring the ward for update on the scan results but they don't pick up. Liaison team have also tried. Yesterday afternoon they put me through but the person I spoke to said they did not treat Mum but would get someone to ring me back but as yet they have not- I was able to arrange a visit for tomorrow.  
I have this morning spoken to Liaison team again who are going to raise a paper request for a return call to me today as the Ward are still not answering phone. I realise how busy the staff are but compared to the Paramedics and the Team in A&E who are under extreme pressure, this experience with the Ward has definitely been lacking in communication skills and totally ignoring next of kin. Due to this experience I am more concerned about the care Mum is being given. I hope a stay in Ward 5E is not detrimental to her health and well being as it has certainly been detrimental to me.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: BelfastBorn
title: Keep up the great work
body: Booster vaccine at the COVID vaccination centre Royal Victoria Hospital Belfast. Thank you to the team staffing the centre. Super job! Really thankful for access to the booster - keeping staff, patients and relatives safer. Keep up the great work 💪🏼

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Boncon
title: The OT has been so good
body: I had a very severe bout of shingles and was diagnosed as having an acute reaction to stress. I was referred to condition management by the mental health nurse in my GP practice and assigned an OT called Liz who has been so good.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: muscayh53
title: Birth & midwifery experience
body:
I had my second child (a boy) in November at CAH.  
I wanted to say a huge thank you for all the care and support from the midwifery team, during my time there.  
Myself and my partner felt always informed and included in all decision making.  
Thank you to mw - Emma, Clare, Patricia , Bronagh, student Kim & Naomi, for your care and support. Also thank you beyond words to Suzanne Mitchell and Orla McClure for being with me through the last stages of labor and getting me the vbac delivery I hoped for. Your words of encouragement and praise I'll never forget.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Terrible practice
body: You could be dieing an nobody answers the phone. It's a complete joke been calling for ages from 8am , little to no staff and doctors seem to be nowhere , it's completely empty and I have to wait 2 days for a prescription to be send it's a complete joke

title: Phone system
body: I called this morning, for the first 7 minutes there was an engaged tone the I was 3rd in the queue for the phone for 20 minutes, only told be told no appointments that they were given away to walk in patients at the surgery how is this system for for people calling on a Monday morning ! Or any other morning , 3 rd in the queue you would of thought an appointment would be offered , your appointment system needs to be reviewed immediately!I also work for a gp practice and find this unacceptable to be 3rd and not offered an appointment

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: This practice seems to have stopped using Patient access and channels all appointment requests through their phone line. They only take appointment calls for the following day if you ring at 8am. The line is then continuously engaged and it is virtually impossible to get an appointment. This is extremely poor service, frustrating and concerning when you are seeking advice regarding a medical issue.  I attempted to ring this practice 70 times today. Always engaged. Guess I'll end up adding to the general NHS A&E burden instead.

title: Useless
body: What is point of being registered with a GP surgery when you cannot see or speak to a doctor? Impossible to get in touch with a doctor. The only option is to call out of hours service. Has gone worst over the years.

author: Popye78
title: Vaccination
body: Very controlled. Staff were lovely. Very quick though very professional and efficient. Thank you.

readBy.name: Office of Shirley-Anne Somerville, MSP for Dunfermline

author: jupiterjd68
title: Rich in kind and considerate workers
body: I had a very bad infection which started on the bridge of my nose and made its way to my right eye. I ended up being admitted to Craigavon Area Hospital over the weekend and spent four days on an iv drip to deal with the infection. Needless to say every single person who worked on the ward from the doctors and nurses to the health care staff and domestics were absolutely amazing. The care I received was above and beyond. The health service may not be financially rich but it is rich in kind and considerate workers and we should be extremely proud we have such workers willing to help people in need.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Shocking
body: I have been with this surgery my whole life and I thought great it would be better when it got taken over, how wrong was I. They dont answer the phone, you request repeat prescriptions and get half the items missing, this is happening every month!! Currently on hold with them and it's been an hour or ring tones!

title: Good practice
body:
Helpful
Good guidance and concerned nurse
Was friendly and patience 
Would recommend 
Good experience e

title: Failing service for self-test antigen certificate
body: I arrived back from Switzerland on Friday, having bought my Day 2 self-test antigen test from Mayfield.  It arrived on Saturday, and I took the test, but since then I have been unable to upload the required photograph to receive my confirmation, and the 'chatbot' has been absolutely useless.  I think their system is currently unavailable?

title: Previously great but today was poor service
body: Called for a call back appointment this morning, was told no appointments available which is fine but I was disappointed not to be asked what it was regarding (so they can check it’s not urgent as not all callers will be able to identify this themselves) or to be offered for them to take my details in case of a cancellation.

title: Very Poor service
body:
I am with this surgery for more than 10years and the service is getting worse 
Not able to get an appointment or even phone appointment if you call them early morning, 
waiting in the call queue for more than an hour to speak to the receptionist and finally, when you get to the front there are no available slots even for phone consultation 
Very frustrating, I  don't think the service will improve in the near future and planning to move from there 
I will make formal complain through NHS website ,

title: Rubbish
body:
Phoned to try and speak to a doctor or may be try and get an appointment for my medication review and couldn’t get past the receptionist.The receptionist has referred me to a pharmacist and they will ring me sometime later in the day. I have blood samples taken for this.ls the pharmacist going to organise this and let me know the outcome.
lf so I will not bother with the doctors I’ll just go to the chemist

title: Unknown????
body: I can't give a review of the Surgery as I have never physically visited it. I can, however, say that the Doctor I spoke to was was very helpful and sorted through the issues I had.

title: Poorest service ever
body: I have registered with the clinic 3 months ago and since then I wasn't able to get any reasonable level of service there. No matter what the issue is, they always make it look like they are trying their best to dismiss everything, provide the most inefficient answers and data, and basically seems they were happy if I never approached them. On one event they gave me the wrong information for over a month and then one day just informed my. "We're sorry you were given the wrong information". Never took any responsibility, never tried to assist me after making me wait over a month for the wrong thing. Sorry for the day I registered with this clinic.

author: Jess2131
title: Poor triage service
body:
I called yesterday as I’m 33+3 weeks pregnant. I have been experiencing severe dizziness/vomiting and headaches. I was told by the first midwife that it sounds like it was related to me having a low blood count which I haven’t been informed about. They said to wait and see my Community midwife at my appointment later in the week but to call back if I felt worse.  
Around 1 hour later I called back as I felt really faint and I was told by the midwife that answered the phone that this is an a&e for pregnant women and that they were too busy to see me just for dizziness. They didn’t even allow me to tell them all my symptoms before saying this to me. I told them how I’m a high risk pregnancy due to a previous second trimester loss at 16 weeks and they still didn't seem concerned. I also made them aware that in my last pregnancy, I was ignored and ultimately that’s how I ended up losing my baby because it was just assumed it was a hormonal rash I had, when it was in fact slapped cheek.  
I found the midwife to be extremely unprofessional. They gave me no reassurance whatsoever. Then went on to tell me it’s probably noravirus I’ve got? I told them so many times I’d like to be seen and I was told no.  
I then ended up phoning St Johns triage who were more than happy to see me as they wanted my OBS checked. They were unable to access my notes so told me to phone NHS24 and advise them of the situation. I was also advised by St. John’s that forth valley triage should have an open door policy with me due to me being a high risk pregnancy.  
I then phoned NHS24, who spoke to FV triage again and they still wouldn’t see me. So they got me an appointment at Stirling out of hours.  
I was told at my appointment that I have 2++ protein, leukolytes and traces of blood in my urine. They said it could be a urine infection or it could be pre-eclpamsia!

title: Terrible appointment booking service
body: The appointment booking process and service is appallingly bad and not fit for purpose. Practice requires people to use the phone to book appointments. Call as soon as the lines open (from 8am, couldn't get through to the on hold service until 8:10am) and wait on hold for over 60 mins just to have a conversation about arranging a telephone appointment. The practice needs to reform it's booking process - e.g. an online ticket system via an official application / website. Most other sectors have resolved this issue with modern technology; it's about time our healthcare did too.

title: Well organised
body: I arrived on time was greeted and shown in to waiting area where I was directed to a room and received the flu vaccination and was out again in five minutes. Very well done good and friendly service.

title: Saved my Life
body: I thought it was about time I said thankyou to the doctor I saw at the surgery on that unforgettable day  in January 2020, when I had awoken the early hours of the morning in the most excruciating pain. I went to the surgery in their emergency slot, where I had an ECG. That gave a normal result and also my pain had subsided. Nevertheless, because of his knowledge and thoroughness in exploring my symptoms the doctor was concerned that there was something serious going on in my body. What that 'something' was he didn't know but he sent me to the hospital that same day where a scan revealed my spleen had ruptured and further tests diagnosed Non Hodgkins Lymphoma. This meant an immediate course of treatment was able to be given, which I had during lockdown, and which was successful. It would have been very easy, because my pain had subsided in its severity, for the doctor to send me home with a direction to go back if I still had pain but he didn't, he rang the N&N to find out where I should report to and then gave me a letter to take to them. So my heartfelt thanks - I am convinced you were instrumental in increasing the years of life I had left.

author: hamruniz
title: Telephone consultation
body: The consultant listened and noted my story, told me what may be wrong, gave me practical advice and suggested an investigation + treatment plan in the shortest reasonable time.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: iamdisappoint
title: MRI scan at Newark hospital
body:
After seeing an ENT specialist at Kings Mill hospital for chronic inner ear pain, I was referred for an MRI scan. An appointment was made for me at Newark hospital - much further away from where I live than Kings Mill, so I assumed there were no MRI facilities at Kings Mill.  
After a long journey and a long wait as appointments were nearly 30 minutes behind schedule, it was only when I got to the scanner unit that I realised that the scanner itself was too small to accommodate plus-size bodies- a standard MRI scanner is apparently just 60cm in diameter. I got in as far as my elbows before realising that the scanner was too tight.  
The technicians then told me that they could book me in for an MRI at Kings Mill, which has a bigger scanner. They also said they'd seen another patient that day who'd had the same issue, and there was someone else in the waiting room, due in after me, who was bigger than me and would likely have found the machine too tight as well.  
The specialist at Kings Mill saw me in person - I'm obviously not a slim person, so either the specialist was not aware of the equipment specs at Newark, or it didn't occur to them that someone my size might have difficulties, or whoever in admin booked the appointment didn't know that this might be an issue. But making a 6 hour round trip on public transport, only to learn that (a) the equipment was unusable for me, and (b) there was a scanner available much closer to home, was infuriating.  
When facilities are not designed to accommodate fat bodies, and when staff do not give consideration to the needs of bigger people, then those people cannot access the same standard of healthcare that slim people get- this is literally systemic fatphobia.

author: Mrs Lump
title: Lump removal
body: All happened very fast. Got told 3 months wait to get lump removed but less than a week later I was in for pre op and operation 2 days later. From very first moment the staff were amazing. Had never had a general anestetic before so was very nervous but everyone made me feel at ease. Excellent service and well looked after. Can't thank the staff enough.

title: Vision better
body: I went for my cataract operation in September, very happy with the outcome my vision is a lot better than it used to be (not 100% as i have other issues with that eye but i expected that). The staff in clinic were very helpful from start to finish and explained everything.

title: Jumping through hoops to speak to my GP
body:
I tried to call multiple times, after going through the options on the automated system. They automatically hang up on you, suggesting people do not want to wait more than 20 minutes. Everytime I have called its the same situation, so essentially you never get to speak to anyone. 

The NHS app does not have the correct options for my condition. Hence the need for guidance on how to proceed. This is absurd.

title: Excellent Experience
body:
Following a diagnosis of breast cancer in February 2021, the care and attention I have received has been top rate.
I have been kept informed at every stage and there have been no surprises.
Every department involved has been brilliant from diagnosis to surgery. I am very thankful to all the people involved in my treatment; mammogram nurses, ultrasound technician, MRI staff, breast care nurses, physiotherapist, all the ward staff and of course my wonderful oncoplastic surgeon.
I have left a separate review relating to the surgery specifically, which was also excellent.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very efficient service
body:
Very satisfied with the service and they provide a very efficient and quick service. I felt safe with the Covid precautions in place and the clinic only allows limited numbers within the unit I attend.
Also parking availability is very good.

author: sonanddaughter
title: Good and bad experience in day surgery
body:
My little girl attended day surgery to have her tonsils and adenoids removed. Initially the experience was fine, the nurse admitting my little girl was lovely and made sure to speak to her as well as myself. The recovery staff member that took her to theatre was also great with her. The theatre staff - anaesthetist team - were all great with her. I was taken into the recovery area so that I could be there for her prior to her getting her GA.  
During pre-assessment I was made aware that I would be in recovery with her, not initially, but that I would be taken along to be with my daughter, I told my daughter I would be there when she woke up - she is only 5 and only turned 5 the week before surgery - so I was shocked when the recovery staff wheeled her back into day surgery. They didn't communicate with me they literally dumped her in day surgery and left - I wasn't told how it went, what exactly she had done, etc. The first thing my little girl said to me was that I wasn't there and I had promised - I was so upset. I communicated the same to a member of staff was abrupt in their approach to me, demanding who told me I could go to recovery, I told her pre-assessment, they said well if that is the case they will be sending an email out to correct that information, as if I would change my mind.  
This staff member said it wasn't protocol, I wasn't allowed in recovery - bearing in mind I was there pre-op. Having been in other NHSL hospitals I know that parents are allowed in recovery. Its daunting for a little one to wake in a room full of strangers, strangers that I question the level of care given considering they didn't converse with me and didn't bother to say goodbye to her when they brought her back - did they actually comfort her on return from surgery - I doubt it.  
This member of staff then abruptly approached the parent next to me to make sure they knew they wasn't allowed in recovery. What a way to speak to anxious parents and to speak to me the way they did in front of my daughter who was already upset as I wasn't there when she woke, I was trying to console her and I had this person bark at me in an awful tone and manner. On return from theatre my daughter also came back to me with a scratch on her R cheek that no one could account for and a cut under her chin that no one seemed aware of, the anaesthetist did apologise for the same, they were also great in the care she provided to my daughter.  
The rest of my experience was fine, the two nurses looking after my daughter post-op where great and made myself and my daughter feel well looked after. It's such a shame that my overall good experience was ruined by one person, the one who should be ensuring that the overall patient experience is a positive one.

author: Mrssl
title: Very efficient service
body:
I attended the queen margaret hospital Dunfermline for a colonoscopy procedure. The staff were brilliant. I was taken on time and the service was very efficient.  
I attended on a Saturday. All staff were friendly, professional and knowledgeable.

readBy.name: Office of Shirley-Anne Somerville, MSP for Dunfermline

title: Brilliant service provider
body: I came in for my laser today. A bit apprehensive at first but absolutely no problems. Very quick and simple. Dr. was very friendly and talking and re assuring.

author: Aggie J
title: Patient Care
body: Would like to thank Sister Sarah and all the nursing staff,Assistants,Ancilliaty staff 4south and Ramone 4 at the love care and attention they gave to my wee family friend who sadly passed away today. Their dedication and devotion second to none. You are truly legends.

title: very quick
body: I had my first eye cataract surgery in stoke - the whole process is quick and i wasn't waiting too long in the clinic on the day. My vision is better already! I'm already booked in for my 2nd eye so very happy with the outcome.

author: jond63
title: Treatment on the ward
body:
I feel let down by a1 ward stepping hill hospital. I was admitted September for approx 5 weeks. unfortunately with covid 19. For 18 days I was in a coma on icu. I have no problem with icu they saved my life as got sepsis.  
As you can imagine I was drugged up to the eye balls not knowing where I was, I was trundled down to a1 early hours of the morning.  
Unbeknown to me I was kicking and lashing out at the porter and the poor doctor. My wife gets a rude awakening, being asked was I a violent man, my wife told them i'm very placid.  
Since I was on that ward I was left to being on my own. I had the shakes so I did not get a drink because I knocked the bottle over, and told of for it. I'm 63 not a child I told them. On one occasion the senior member of staff got security on me because I wanted to discharge my self and was kicking up a fuss, it was silly really on both sides as I could not walk. After that I felt the staff had it in for me.  
Only one nurse, god bless her understood. The senior member of staff even took the sim out of my phone, I did not realize till I got home.  
In truth it was a living hell. It still is, I suffer with ptsd, not just of the covid but with the experience on a1.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Great Service
body: I have attended the Community Eye Care clinics for a few appointments now and everything is always find and the clinics run with no issues. I receive confirmation of outcomes and any follow ups are promptly scheduled.

author: Moijaaa
title: Visiting the STI clinic
body: I had an appointment this morning at Burrell Street sexual health clinic . I was seen by a nurse named Lorna who was extremely professional she was understanding and very caring. As I thought I was in a monogamous and committed relationship I was devastated to find I required treatment. Lorna was so kind and made the whole process much easier for me to deal with and I would like to thank her for the kindness and compassion that she showed to me today.

author: bravonc38
title: Great team
body:
Great team most kind, and on the call - wonderful!  
Special mention to Laura in Medical Oncology and Jackie who seem to get the short straw with me for each treatment.  
Great team, don't change it.  
Thank you all.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful Nurse
body: I went in to see a nurse at Simpson House Medical Centre this morning. I am quite nervous about needles, which is something that not all health care professionals are understanding about. The nurse I saw today was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and kind; she put me at ease right away. I cannot imagine the pressure our NHS staff are under at the moment, but I am incredibly appreciative that this member of staff was so kind, friendly and helpful. Huge thank you to her and to the team.

title: Great service
body: Moved to the area 3 years ago and due to existing conditions have had many occasions where I have needed either a telephone consultation or an appointment with the doctor,  And have found the service excellent and very caring

title: Best surgery I've dealt with
body:
I have been registered with this surgery for seven years. They are easy to contact by telephone, and regularly have availability for urgent appointments at short notice. The staff are friendly, and the GPs are knowledgeable. I would recommend this surgery to anyone who has recently moved to the area.

Furthermore, the surgery has good working relationships with the local pharmacies.
